quote_first: We have three years of the past to discuss. Let that suffice until
quote_last: , when we start upon the notable adventure of the empty house.
title: The Empty House
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quote_last: he was sitting on the edge of his bed looking at his watch. He put it to his ear. Then his lips drew back from his teeth in that curious wolf-like smile characteristic of the man. He said very softly: “I think the time has come to do something about this.”
title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie

quote_first: Forty-eight years old, profoundly asleep at
quote_last: on a Friday night - this is modern professional life.
title: Saturday
author: Ian McEwan
